p.s: The speech Remarks of president Barack Obama at student roundtable by Barack Obama from the 7th April 2009 in Istanbul at the student roundtable at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University in Tophane takes action about the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges.
He addressaddresses his speech to young people and young muslims in Turkey.

The speech has 5 paragraphs but also can be structured into 3 parts since the first paragraph is the introduction, the second to fourth paragraphs are the main part and the last paragraph is the conclusion.
Barack Obama talks in the introduction about rebuilding the relationship between the US and the muslims.
In the main part he says that there are many young people who have energy and passion to study abroad or to volunteer abroad.
He also outlines the positive aspektsaspects of studying abroad like learinglearning new languages, serving and studying with people from the whole world.
In the conclusion he sums up his opinion and raises awernesawareness to study in the USA, where you will find a partner, supporter and friend.
He trystries to involve his audience by directly talking to them (l. 3).

To catch their attention he mentionmentions people who he knows from other countryscountries so the audience can feel like a part of the programmprogram and share their interest in the following discussion at the students' roundtable (ll. 5-8).
His intention is to make clear that he wants everyone to take part in this progress of travelingtravelling in another country so they can get or share their experience (ll. 13-16).
He talks directly to the audience by using the pronoun you.
In general you can say that Barack Obama is involving his audience and that he has a lot of experience with the topic travelingtravelling abroad and talking to students.
